verses.text: And Solomon determined to build an house for the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and an house for his kingdom.
And Solomon told out threescore and ten thousand men to bear burdens , and fourscore thousand to hew in the mountain , and three thousand and six hundred to oversee them. \p

¶ And Solomon sent to Huram the king of Tyre , saying , As thou didst deal with David my father , and didst send him cedars to build him an house to dwell therein, \add even so deal with me\add*.\f + \fr 2.3 \ft Huram: or, Hiram\f*

Behold, I build an house to the name of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* my God , to dedicate \add it\add* to him, \add and\add* to burn before him sweet incense , and for the continual shewbread , and for the burnt offerings morning and evening , on the sabbaths , and on the new moons , and on the solemn feasts of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* our God. This \add is an ordinance\add* for ever to Israel.  +  r 2.4  t sweet…: Heb. incense of spices *
And the house which I build \add is\add* great : for great \add is\add* our God above all gods.

But who is able to build him an house , seeing the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain him? who \add am\add* I then, that I should build him an house , save only to burn sacrifice before him?\f + \fr 2.6 \ft is able: Heb. hath retained, or, obtained strength\f*

Send me now therefore a man cunning to work in gold , and in silver , and in brass , and in iron , and in purple , and crimson , and blue , and that can skill to grave with the cunning men that \add are\add* with me in Judah and in Jerusalem , whom David my father did provide.\f + \fr 2.7 \ft to grave: Heb. to grave gravings\f*

Send me also cedar trees , fir trees , and algum trees , out of Lebanon : for I know that thy servants can skill to cut timber in Lebanon ; and, behold, my servants \add shall be\add* with thy servants ,\f + \fr 2.8 \ft algum: also called, almuggim\f*
Even to prepare me timber in abundance : for the house which I am about to build \add shall be\add* wonderful great.\f + \fr 2.9 \ft wonderful…: Heb. great and wonderful\f*

And, behold, I will give to thy servants , the hewers that cut timber , twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat , and twenty thousand measures of barley , and twenty thousand baths of wine , and twenty thousand baths of oil. \p
¶ Then Huram the king of Tyre answered in writing , which he sent to Solomon , Because the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath loved his people , he hath made thee king over them.

Huram said moreover, Blessed \add be\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Israel , that made heaven and earth , who hath given to David the king a wise son , endued with prudence and understanding , that might build an house for the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and an house for his kingdom.  +  r 2.12  t endued…: Heb. knowing prudence and understanding *
And now I have sent a cunning man , endued with understanding , of Huram my father’s ,

The son of a woman of the daughters of Dan , and his father \add was\add* a man of Tyre , skilful to work in gold , and in silver , in brass , in iron , in stone , and in timber , in purple , in blue , and in fine linen , and in crimson ; also to grave any manner of graving , and to find out every device which shall be put to him, with thy cunning men , and with the cunning men of my lord David thy father.
Now therefore the wheat , and the barley , the oil , and the wine , which my lord hath spoken of, let him send unto his servants :

And we will cut wood out of Lebanon , as much as thou shalt need : and we will bring it to thee in floats by sea to Joppa ; and thou shalt carry it up to Jerusalem.\f + \fr 2.16 \ft as much…: Heb according to all thy need\f*\f + \fr 2.16 \ft Joppa: Heb. Japho\f* \p

¶ And Solomon numbered all the strangers that \add were\add* in the land of Israel , after the numbering wherewith David his father had numbered them; and they were found an hundred and fifty thousand and three thousand and six hundred.\f + \fr 2.17 \ft the strangers: Heb. the men the strangers\f*

And he set threescore and ten thousand of them \add to be\add* bearers of burdens , and fourscore thousand \add to be\add* hewers in the mountain , and three thousand and six hundred overseers to set the people a work.
